intro: Cremanthodium purpureifolium, commonly known as the purple-leafed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and meadows. It has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus.
